creator: Canowie

content:
If you are talking about the 'Global Search' function then see if the Global database needs rebuilding.

  • Menu app icon > Help > More TRoubleshooting Information
  • under 'Application Basics' - hald way - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'

a new window opens showing the content of your profile name folder

  • Exit Thunderbird now. This is important.
  • Delete the file called : global-messages-db.sqlite
  • Start Thunderbird.


Note: Check to see if any folders need to be selected to allow global search.

  • Right click on folder and select 'Properties'
  • Select checkbox 'Include messages in this folder in Global Search results'


More info:

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database
creator: Toad-Hall

content: You haven't shown the smtp settings. They should be: smtp.office365.com on port 587, STARTTLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address. The incoming should be outlook.office365.com on 993 (IMAP) or 995 (POP), SSL/TLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address. Uncheck 'Place a copy in' in Copies & Folders, as sent mail is automatically copied to Sent (IMAP).

content:
• Menu app icon > Help > More TRoubleshooting Information
  • under 'Application Basics' - hald way - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'

a new window opens showing the content of your profile name folder

  • Exit Thunderbird now. This is important.
  • click on 'Mail ' folder
  • click on the pop account name folder to see contents

You will see mbox files with same name as folders you normally see in Folder Pane - they do NOT have any extension. These files contain emails. Do NOT delete any of those mbox files.

You should see a load of index files - they have a .msf extension. Delete all the * .msf files.

If you have any folders with a .sbd extension - it means you have some subfolders. Click on those '*.sbd' folders to see contents and delete any files with the .msf extension

When finished Start Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: The beta version is not recommended for day-to-day use, as it is predicted to be buggy and exists for testing only. If you wish to continue with beta, please use the beta forum at https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/beta. In settings>general, you can unset the option to update automatically.
creator: davidsk
